H0.text: who is the originator of the plan-do-check-act model of performance improvement. Joseph Juran

H1.text: who is the originator of the plan-do-check-act model of performance improvement. Philip Crosby

H2.text: who is the originator of the plan-do-check-act model of performance improvement. Armand Feigenbaum

H3.text: who is the originator of the plan-do-check-act model of performance improvement. W. Edwards Deming

A4.text: It is a common myth to credit Plan-Do-Check-Act (PDCA) to Deming.

A5.text: Deming always referred to the Cycle as the Shewhart Cycle for Continuous Learning and Improvement.

A6.text: Plan–do–check–act is associated with W. Edwards Deming, who is considered by many to be the father of modern quality control; however, he used PDSA (Plan-Do-Study-Act) and referred to it as the 'Shewhart cycle'.

A7.text: According to Deming, during his lectures in Japan in the early 1950s, the Japanese participants shortened the steps to the now traditional plan, do, check, act.
